item.title: Comment on The market price reactions by some straussian guy
item.description:
This is one of those Straussian posts where Tyler's real point is how incredibly dumb it is to look at initial market reactions to events after a little bit of uncertainty has been resolved, when the medium term consequences are still unknown. Brilliant, as always Tyler.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/the-market-price-reactions.html?commentID=160831264

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/the-market-price-reactions.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=the-market-price-reactions

item.title: Comment on What is the Best-Case Scenario for a Trump Presidency? by Pillow Lasers
item.description:
Reply to Crikey:

Also, he might give you a pony.

Best case scenario, people start to admit that maybe elections aren’t rigged by Democrats after all and Trump actually lost in 2020.

Just kidding, believers of the great lie will demonstrate that unstoppable human tendency to rationalize away any cognitive dissonance.

item.title: Comment on Rising in status by Claus Vistesen
item.dc:creator: Claus Vistesen

item.title: Comment on Rising in status by Hadur
item.description:
Trump, obviously.

In 2016, Trump almost universally did worse than generic Republicans running for Congress in the same state. Trump won Ohio and Pennsylvania, but Republicans won Senate elections in those states by more than Trump.

In 2024, opposite story. Trump is running ahead of generic Republicans running for Senate and Congress. Good news for the libs, I suppose: this was Trump's last election and there are few reasons to think that the non-traditional GOP voters who voted for Trump will transfer that loyalty to whatever generic Republican comes after him.

The exit polls were fairly accurate this year too, a rarity in the USA.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/rising-in-status.html?commentID=160831097

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/rising-in-status.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rising-in-status

Votes: 54⬆ 1⬇
item.dc:creator: Hadur

item.title: Comment on Rising in status by Jazi Zilber
item.description:
Median voter theorem.

Biden moved left after being elected as a centrist. (border spending regulations DEI)

the bubble thought that since he's merely leftist at 60-65 percentile it's good enough for the 50th percentage voter.

had Dems used either of Obama 2008/2012 platforms, they might've won.
